title: WFP warns of ‘massive’ humanitarian aid crisis in Sudan as war rages
summary: The World Food Programme's Carl Skau says the fighting is stopping aid from reaching millions in desperate need.

title: Yan upsets Dvalishvili to capture bantamweight championship at UFC 323
summary: Petr Yan stunned favourite Merab Dvalishvili at UFC 323 in Las Vegas to end the Georgian's 14-fight winning streak.

title: Lionel Messi, Inter Miami defeat Vancouver to win first MLS Cup title
summary: The Argentinian super star capped off his third Major League Soccer season with the 47th trophy of his career.

title: Sri Lanka landslides feared as toll hits 618, widespread loss sweeps Asia
summary: Disaster agency warns that monsoon storms are adding more rain and making hillsides unstable.

title: What has Germany’s position been on Israel’s genocide in Gaza?
summary: Germany is Israel’s second-largest arms supplier, fifth-largest export partner, and one of its staunchest supporters.

title: LIVE: Israel targets Gaza as mediators warn ceasefire at ‘critical moment’
summary: Israeli air raids hit Maghazi camp in central Gaza as mediators warn the ceasefire is at a 'critical moment'.

title: Hope, flags, fireworks as Syria starts to celebrate a year without al-Assad
summary: Syrians gathered to celebrate days before the December 8 anniversary, which will mark the day the capital was liberated.

title: Hong Kong votes in ‘patriots only’ polls amid anger over deadly fire
summary: Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee urges the public to come out and vote amid expectations of a low turnout.

title: Supporters of Venezuela’s Machado rally in cities around the world
summary: From Madrid to Lima, and Buenos Aires to Brisbane, supporters celebrate the opposition leader's Nobel Peace prize win.

title: Japan accuses Chinese jets of directing fire-control radar at its aircraft
summary: Beijing says Japanese self-defence force aircraft repeatedly approached and disrupted the Chinese navy's training.

title: Bodies of 17 people found in boat off of Greece’s Crete
summary: Greek coastguard says two survivors in critical condition have been hospitalised.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,382
summary: These are the key developments from day 1,382 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: À Jérusalem, Friedrich Merz assure Israël du soutien "immuable" de l'Allemagne
summary: En visite pour la première fois dans l'État hébreu depuis sa prise de fonction, le chancelier allemand l'a assuré samedi du soutien "immuable" de l'Allemagne. Friedrich Merz doit rencontrer dimanche le Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu, de plus en plus isolé sur le plan international, pour discuter avec lui des efforts en vue de passer à une deuxième phase du cessez-le-feu à Gaza.

title: Un an après la chute d'Assad, le défi de la justice transitionnelle en Syrie
summary: Pendant plus de cinquante ans, la famille Assad s'est maintenue au pouvoir en perpétrant des crimes de guerre et des crimes contre l'humanité. Deux commissions dédiées à la justice transitionnelle ont été mises en place par les nouvelles autorités mais le processus s'annonce long et complexe. Entretien.

title: Gaza : le Hamas prêt à remettre ses armes à une autorité palestinienne, "si l'occupation cesse"
summary: Le chef du Hamas pour Gaza se dit prêt à remettre ses armes à une future autorité palestinienne à Gaza si l'occupation israélienne cesse. Khalil al-Hayya déclare accepter une force de l’ONU pour superviser un cessez-le-feu, mais refuse toute mission visant à le désarmer.

title: Selon Al-Charaa, la volonté d’Israël de démilitariser le sud de la Syrie met la région en danger
summary: Le président syrien par intérim Ahmed al-Charaa a mis en garde contre la demande israélienne d'établir une zone démilitarisée au sud de la Syrie. Il estime qu'elle remettrait en cause l'accord de désengagement de 1974 et placerait Damas dans une position "grave et dangereuse".

title: Syrie : premier anniversaire de la chute de l'ex président Bachar al-Assad
summary: Une délégation du Conseil de sécurité de l'ONU est arrivée jeudi en Syrie, pour une toute première visite dans ce pays, à quelques jours du premier anniversaire de la chute de l'ex président Bachar al-Assad, a rapporté l'agence Sana.

title: Le cessez-le-feu à Gaza reste incomplet sans "un retrait total" d'Israël, estime le Qatar
summary: En vigueur depuis près de deux mois, le cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza ne pourra être considéré comme complet qu'après le retrait total des forces israéliennes, a déclaré samedi le Premier ministre du Qatar, médiateur dans le conflit qui oppose le territoire palestinien occupé et l'État hébreu.

title: Le Liban exhorte l'ONU à faire pression sur Israël pour le respect du cessez-le-feu
summary: Le président libanais Joseph Aoun a appelé vendredi une délégation du Conseil de sécurité des Nations unies à faire pression sur Israël pour que le pays respecte le cessez-le-feu signé avec le Hezbollah il y a un an. Des responsables civils libanais et israéliens ont participé mercredi pour la première fois à un comité de surveillance du cessez-le-feu.

title: Israël boycotté par le Guinness World Records ? Ce que l'on sait de ces accusations
summary: Début décembre, le Guinness World Records a refusé d'homologuer un record à une association israélienne, provoquant nombre de critiques en ligne dénonçant un "boycott". Mais selon la société britannique qui gère les records, cette décision est une mesure temporaire prise en raison de la guerre à Gaza, qui s'applique également aux territoires palestiniens.

title: Une milice anti-Hamas confirme la mort de son chef Yasser Abou Shebab à Rafah
summary: Chef d'un clan bédouin qui avait pris la tête d'une milice palestinienne anti-Hamas avec le soutien d'Israël à la faveur de la guerre dans la bande de Gaza, Yasser Abou Shebab a été mortellement blessé par balle, a déclaré sa milice jeudi.

title: "Ils font ce qu'ils veulent" : des Palestiniens racontent la vague d'attaques de colons en Cisjordanie
summary: En Cisjordanie, les attaques des colons israéliens contre les Palestiniens ont atteint un niveau historique ces derniers mois. Israël affirme que ces actes ne sont le fait que de quelques individus radicaux, mais des victimes, des militants israéliens et des groupes de défense des droits humains affirment au contraire que tout un système soutenu par l'État protège les responsables.

title: Israël annonce avoir identifié la dépouille de l'avant-dernier otage détenu à Gaza
summary: La dépouille d'un ressortissant thaïlandais qui était détenu à Gaza a été identifiée jeudi, a annoncé l'armée israélienne. Il s'agissait de l'avant-dernier otage que le Hamas s'était engagé à restituer dans le cadre de l'accord de trêve.

title: Israël annonce avoir reçu la dépouille d'un otage de Gaza par l'intermédiaire du CICR
summary: Le gouvernement israélien a annoncé mercredi avoir reçu la dépouille d'un otage par l'intermédiaire du Comité international de la Croix-Rouge. Le cercueil contenant le corps en question est en route vers l'Institut national de médecine légale, à Tel-Aviv, où une autopsie doit permettre d'identifier la victime.

title: Piercings extrêmes et régime végétarien : plongée dans l’impressionnant festival taoïste de Phuket, en Thaïlande
summary: Chaque année, le Festival des neuf dieux empereurs envahit les rues de la station balnéaire thaïlandaise, transformant la ville en lieu de culte où l’on peut assister à des mutilations extrêmes, des transes religieuses et des épreuves de marche sur le feu.

title: Le Japon accuse la Chine d’« actes dangereux » au large de l’île d’Okinawa
summary: Selon Tokyo, des avions militaires chinois ont ciblé avec leurs radars des avions de chasse japonais, dans l’extrême sud de l’archipel nippon.

title: Le réalisateur Kleber Mendonça Filho, moteur d’un cinéma brésilien en plein regain
summary: Depuis sa ville du Nordeste, qui occupe le haut de l’affiche dans sa filmographie, le cinéaste de 57 ans s’est imposé comme le fer de lance du renouveau du cinéma brésilien. L’auteur de films à la fois exigeants et pofpulaires a triomphé au dernier Festival de Cannes avec « L’Agent secret ». Cette intrigue trouble sur fond de dictature militaire, devenue un phénomène culturel dans son pays, sortira en France le 17 décembre.

title: Dans le nord d’Haïti, les paysans unissent leurs forces pour lutter contre la sécheresse et le changement climatique
summary: Après deux décennies de sécheresses intenses qui menaçaient leur activité, les paysans de la plaine de Maribahoux, lassés de l’incurie du gouvernement haïtien, ont entrepris de construire un canal pour irriguer ce bassin rizicole de 12 000 hectares. Un an et demi après l’arrivée de l’eau dans les champs, les résultats sont tangibles.

title: Voir et entendre « La voix de Hind Rajab », au-delà d’un film sur une enfant tuée à Gaza
summary: L’œuvre exceptionnelle de Kaouther Ben Hania est moins un film sur Gaza et Hind Rajab, assassinée par des chars israéliens, qu’un film sur notre impuissance individuelle et collective à entraver l’horreur du massacre, analyse l’historien Jean-Pierre Filiu dans sa chronique.

title: Roumanie : une journaliste adepte des fake news, soutenue par l’extrême droite, vise la mairie de Bucarest
summary: Sept mois après l’élection à la présidence de la République de l’ancien maire Nicusor Dan, des municipales anticipées sont organisées le 7 décembre dans la capitale roumaine. La course est serrée, et la candidate Anca Alexandrescu, vedette de la télévision soutenue par les partis conservateurs et nationalistes, fait partie des favoris.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : Volodymyr Zelensky va rencontrer Emmanuel Macron, Keir Starmer et Friedrich Merz lundi à Londres
summary: La réunion a pour objectif de faire le point sur « les négociations en cours dans le cadre de la médiation américaine », a annoncé le président français. « Nous devons continuer à faire pression sur la Russie pour la contraindre à la paix », a-t-il également déclaré samedi sur X, réitérant son « soutien indéfectible » à Kiev.

title: David Sacks, le fer de lance des « tech bros » à Washington
summary: Le magnat réactionnaire de la tech, conseiller spécial de Donald Trump sur les cryptomonnaies et l’intelligence artificielle, illustre le niveau de collusion inédit entre le gouvernement et la Silicon Valley.

title: Inde : 25 morts dans l’incendie d’une discothèque à Goa
summary: Au moins trois touristes figurent parmi les victimes, ont précisé les autorités indiennes. Le feu s’est déclaré dans une boîte de nuit faisant partie d’un hôtel à Arpora, dans le nord de la station balnéaire.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : Volodymyr Zelensky dit avoir eu une conversation téléphonique « substantielle et constructive » avec les émissaires américains Steve Witkoff et Jared Kushner. Les informations du 30 novembre au 6 décembre
summary: Les négociateurs ukrainiens et américains se sont retrouvés samedi en Floride pour leur troisième jour de discussions sur le plan de Washington visant à mettre fin à la guerre avec la Russie.

title: En visite en Israël, Friedrich Merz assure l’Etat hébreu du soutien « immuable » de l’Allemagne
summary: « Se tenir au côté de ce pays fait partie du noyau essentiel, immuable de la politique de la République fédérale d’Allemagne et le restera », a déclaré, samedi à Jérusalem, le chancelier au président israélien, Isaac Herzog.

title: De saint Nicolas à Santa Claus, le Père Noël sous tous ses avatars
summary: Des croisades à Coca-Cola, le mythe a connu de multiples métamorphoses à travers ses péréginations.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • At least seven people have been killed by Israeli fire in Gaza City and northern areas of the strip, Al Jazeera reported, as Israel continues attacks across the so-called "yellow line" demarcating the buffer zone. 

  • Hamas said Saturday it was ready to hand over its weapons in the Gaza Strip to the Palestinian Authority governing the territory on the condition that the Israeli army's occupation ends.

  • The Israeli military said its soldiers shot and killed two people in Hebron in the occupied West Bank during what it described as “operational activity”.

  • Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian-owned land in Mekhmas and targeted Bedouin shepherds near the occupied Jerusalem, the Wafa news agency reported.

  • A senior official from Saudi Arabia said a two-state solution is the only way forward for Israel and Palestine, Al Jazeera reported.

  • Qatar and Egypt called on Israel to withdraw from Gaza and for an international stabilisation force be deployed, steps they say are essential to fully carry out the fragile agreement.

  • Turkish foreign minister Hakan Fidan said talks on the make-up of the Gaza stabilisation force remain ongoing.

  • US President Donald Trump will name two Gaza authorities under his peace plan during Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's visit to Washington this month.

title: Two-state solution is the only way forward, says Saudi Arabia
summary:
Two-state solution is the only way forward, says Saudi Arabia

A senior official from Saudi Arabia said a two-state solution is the only way forward for Israel and Palestine, Al Jazeera reported.

Manal Radwan, an official in the foreign ministry, told the Doha Forum 2025 that US President Trump’s peace plan is clear and should not be renegotiated again.

“We cannot go back and redefine what we mean by ceasefire, what we mean even by disarmament, what we mean by a Palestinian-led process in governing Gaza,” Rawan said.

“Almost everyone in the international community agrees that the two-state solution is the only solution forward. If that is so, then it is asking people what it is that they are going to do to bring this implementation and make it possible," she added.

title: Israeli settlers block shepherds near Jerusalem
summary:
Israeli settlers block shepherds near Jerusalem

Israeli settlers on Saturday attacked Palestinian-owned land in Mekhmas, northeast of occupied Jerusalem, and targeted Bedouin shepherds near Khan al-Ahmar to the east, the Wafa news agency reported.

Local sources said the settlers released their cows into olive fields in the Wadi al-Baradiya area of Mekhmas before attempting to attack nearby homes. Young residents intervened, forcing the settlers to withdraw.

In a related incident, armed settlers targeted the Bedouin community near Khan al-Ahmar, east of occupied Jerusalem, while other settlers assaulted shepherds and prevented them from taking their flocks to grazing areas.

title: Israel kills two Palestinians at security checkpoint in Hebron
summary:
Israel kills two Palestinians at security checkpoint in Hebron

The Israeli military said its soldiers shot and killed two people in Hebron in the occupied West Bank during what it described as “operational activity”.

In a brief statement on Telegram, the army said the two accelerated their car towards soldiers at a security checkpoint.

“The soldiers fired at the terrorists and eliminated them,” it said.

title: Hamas says will give up arms to a Palestinian authority 'if occupation ends'
summary:
Hamas says will give up arms to a Palestinian authority 'if occupation ends'

Hamas said Saturday it was ready to hand over its weapons in the Gaza Strip to the Palestinian Authority governing the territory on the condition that the Israeli army's occupation ends.

“Our weapons are linked to the existence of the occupation and the aggression,” Hamas chief negotiator and its Gaza chief Khalil al-Hayya said in a statement, adding: “If the occupation ends, these weapons will be placed under the authority of the state."

Asked by AFP, Hayya's bureau said he was referring to a sovereign and independent Palestinian state.

"We accept the deployment of UN forces as a separation force, tasked with monitoring the borders and ensuring compliance with the ceasefire in Gaza ," Hayya added, signalling his group's rejection of the deployment of an international force in the Strip whose mission would be to disarm it.

title: Christmas lights return to Bethlehem amid fragile ceasefire
summary:
Christmas lights return to Bethlehem amid fragile ceasefire

A giant Christmas tree adorned with red and gold baubles stands in the occupied West Bank city of Bethlehem for the first time since the start of Israel's war on Gaza.

The Palestinian city, revered by Christians as the birthplace of Jesus, had refrained from public Christmas celebrations over the past two years.

But as a precarious ceasefire in Gaza enters its second month, the city held a ceremony on Saturday night, lighting up the 20-metre tree at the edge of Manger Square.

Thousands of Palestinians from across the West Bank and Israel filled the square, erupting in cheers when the tree's lights were turned on shortly before 8 pm.

title: Two more Palestinians injured by Israeli fire in Al-Ram
summary:
Two more Palestinians injured by Israeli fire in Al-Ram

Two Palestinians were wounded on Saturday evening by live fire from Israeli forces in the town of Al-Ram, north-east of occupied Jerusalem, the Wafa news agency reported.

The Palestinian Red Crescent Society said its crews treated two men, aged 47 and 27, who were shot in the lower limbs near the Israeli separation wall adjacent to Al-Ram. Both were taken to a hospital.

Earlier in the evening, Red Crescent teams had also treated two other Palestinians from Salfit who were shot near the wall in Al-Ram and transferred to the hospital.

title: In photos: Rescuers search for remains of victims in Bureij refugee camp
summary: In photos: Rescuers search for remains of victims in Bureij refugee camp

title: Germany's Merz makes first visit to Jerusalem as chancellor
summary:
Germany's Merz makes first visit to Jerusalem as chancellor

German Chancellor Friedrich Merz heads to Jerusalem on Saturday for his first visit since taking office, aiming to reaffirm traditionally solid ties that were shaken during Israel's war on Gaza.

Merz stopped in Jordan briefly on Saturday for talks with King Abdullah II, which Merz told reporters afterwards had focused largely on the fragile peace process.

Speaking before flying on to Jerusalem, Merz urged more humanitarian aid to flow into Gaza and for Hamas to lay down their weapons. He said Jordan and Germany both remain committed to a negotiated two-state solution.

title: Israeli forces arrest five people in the occupied West Bank
summary:
Israeli forces arrest five people in the occupied West Bank

Israeli forces have arrested five young men from the town of Azzun, east of Qalqilya, in the occupied West Bank, the Wafa news agency reported.

The local sources said the soldiers stormed the town and arrested two brothers, Ibrahim and Muhammad Khalil Sweidan and three others, Mahmoud Tayseer Sweidan, Ahmed Taleb Nassar, and Muhammad Ayman Majd

Israeli soldiers also assaulted the town of Kafr Thulth, south of Qalqilya.

title: US sanctions equate us with drug traffickers, ICC deputy prosecutor says
summary:
US sanctions equate us with drug traffickers, ICC deputy prosecutor says

The deputy prosecutor of the International Criminal Court on Friday lashed out at US sanctions, arguing they effectively put top court officials on a par with "terrorists and drug traffickers".

In a wide-ranging interview with AFP, Mame Mandiaye Niang also said it would be "conceivable" to hold an in-absentia hearing against high-level ICC targets such as Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

Sixty-five-year-old Niang, along with top ICC judges, is subject to sanctions from the administration of US President Donald Trump, in retaliation at the court's arrest warrants for Netanyahu over Israel's war on Gaza.

"You can disagree with what we're doing. That happens all the time," Niang told AFP in a one-to-one interview on the sixth floor of the ICC's building in The Hague.

"But even if we upset you, you should never put us on the same list as terrorists or drug traffickers. That is the message" to Trump.

title: Norway warns Gaza ceasefire 'fragile', urges swift deployment of stabilisation force
summary:
Norway warns Gaza ceasefire 'fragile', urges swift deployment of stabilisation force

Norway's Foreign Minister Espen Barth Eide said on Saturday that the Gaza stabilisation force and the Board of Peace must be put in place this month, adding that the current ceasefire was "fragile and cannot hold for many more weeks in its current phase".

Speaking at the Doha Forum in Qatar, he said the international stabilisation force needed to function as a peacekeeping force.

title: Iranian students stand firm against global arrogance: Speaker Ghalibaf
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf has referred to the long-standing hostility of global arrogance toward Iranian students, praising them for standing against foreign domination.

title: Foreign minister hails students for their efforts to uphold Iran’s dignity
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has praised university students for their role in elevating Iran’s standing on the international scientific stage, describing them as “diplomats of the field of science and knowledge.”

title: Iran’s foreign minister to visit Baku on Sunday
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baqaei says Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi will travel to Azerbaijan on Sunday for talks with senior officials in Baku.

title: Chairman of SCO Executive Committee welcomes Iran active and influential presence
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Regional Anti-Terrorism Structure of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization met and held talks with the Director General for Shanghai Cooperation Organization and BRICS Affairs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Islamic Republic of Iran in Tabriz on Saturday.

title: Iran and Belarus emphasize facilitating and expanding trade ties
summary: Tehran, IRNA – In a meeting with the Belarusian ambassador in Tehran, the head of the Trade Promotion Organization of Iran emphasized the expansion of trade cooperation between the two countries, and said that convening a joint commission meeting can facilitate many trade issues between the two countries.

title: Iran keen on utilizing nuclear technologies to improve quality of life: VP
summary: Tehran, IRNA – First Vice President Mohammad Reza Aref says the current Iranian administration supports maximizing nuclear technologies to improve the quality of life, particularly by ensuring the electricity needs of the people are met.

title: US policies rooted in terrorism and organized crime, Iran MP tells Venezuela envoy
summary: Tehran, IRNA – A senior Iranian lawmaker has criticized the United States for backing terrorism and organized crime while using the same issues as a pretext for military intervention in other countries.

title: Iran, Egypt FMs hold talks on bilateral ties, regional issues
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and his Egyptian counterpart, Badr Abdelatty, have discussed bilateral relations and current regional developments.

title: Navy operational command now extends to high seas: Commander
summary: Nowshahr, IRNA – The Commander of the Iranian Army’s Naval Force, Rear Admiral Shahram Irani, says that naval operations have expanded from the Strait of Hormuz to the northern Persian Gulf and have now reached distant waters and oceans.

title: Iran says national jailed in Japan has been transferred home
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Justice Ministry announced that an Iranian citizen imprisoned in Japan has been returned to the country to serve the remainder of his sentence.

title: Khaled Mashal: Resistance and its arms must be preserved
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Hamas leader abroad, Khaled Mashal, has stressed opposition to any form of trusteeship over Gaza, declaring that resistance and its weapons must be preserved.

title: Seawater transfer to central Iran to help power industries: Pezeshkian
summary: Isfahan, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian says industries in Isfahan province will no longer require underground resources with the arrival of seawater from the Persian Gulf to the central Iranian plateau.

title: Iran rules out any special, direct channel with Washington
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – Iran’s Foreign Ministry spokesperson has stated that there is no direct or special channel of communication between Tehran and Washington.

title: Egypt warns Israel against unilateral reopening of Rafah
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – Egypt has warned Israel through multiple channels that it rejects any unilateral reopening of the Rafah crossing.

title: 'Azar 16th' symbol of anti-global arrogance in Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – In Iranian calendar, the day Azar 16th (December 7) has been designated as University Students Day that is the symbol of the anti-global arrogance and anti-colonialism approach of the students and the university in history.

title: Why did FIFA invent a peace prize for Trump?
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – FIFA’s Peace Prize was supposed to symbolize “the unifying power of football,” but in practice, it turned into a display of the organization’s political maneuvering and an attempt to whitewash the image of Donald Trump.

title: Ghalibaf warns regional states over testing Iran's patience
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – Iran’s Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf warned that those making claims over the three Iranian islands should not test the Iranian nation’s determination to defend its territorial integrity.

title: US armed forces learning lessons from conflict in Ukraine
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – The United States is studying the experience of using autonomous weapon systems during combat operations in Ukraine, War Secretary Pete Hegseth says.

title: Merz urges Israel to refrain from annexing West Bank
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has called on Israel to refrain from any steps toward annexing the West Bank, including building communities there.

title: 7.0 magnitude earthquake shakes Alaska
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – An earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0 was registered in Alaska, the US Geological Survey (USGS) reported.

title: 30th International Children and Youth Theater Festival
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – The 30th International Children and Youth Theater Festival in Hamedan opened with a lively parade of 120 theatrical puppets from Avicenna’s Mausoleum to Imam Khomeini Square.

title: Hamas sets condition for handing over its weapons
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – Khalil al-Hayya, the head of Hamas in Gaza, said the movement will only hand over its weapons once Israel’s occupation ends, adding that arms would then be transferred to a future Palestinian state authority governing Gaza.

title: Araghchi wants Japan to play key safety role at nuclear sites
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi on Saturday called for Japan to share its expertise with past atomic disasters and help Iran secure facilities severely damaged by recent Israeli and US strikes.

title: Iran’s foreign minister to visit Azerbaijan for talks
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 07 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Ministry Spokesman Esmaeil Baghaei announced that Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi will travel to Azerbaijan on Sunday for high-level talks with senior officials in Baku.

title: دریادار مطلبی: نظریه دانشگاه دریایی هوشمند توسط ایران در جهان ثبت شد
summary: نوشهر - فرمانده دانشگاه دریایی حضرت امام خمینی (ره) نوشهر از ارائه نظریه‌ای در حوزه «دانشگاه‌های هوشمند و تحول آموزش با بهره‌گیری از فناوری‌های نوین» توسط ایران در چین خبر داد.

title: کریمی: ۱۲۴ ایده به رویداد ملی سپر نوآوری در نوشهر ارسال شد
summary: نوشهر - دبیر ملی رویداد سپر نوآوری از ارسال ۱۲۴ ایده نوآورانه از سراسر کشور به رویداد خبر داد.

title: ۱۸ دستگاه ماینر قاچاق در غرب هرمزگان کشف شد
summary: بندرعباس- فرمانده دریابانی بندرلنگه از کشف ۱۸ دستگاه ماینر توسط مرزداران شهرستان بندرلنگه خبر داد.

title: خریدهای اعتباری بازیگر جدید و پیشتاز جمعه سیاه ایرانی
summary: داده‌های تجمیعی CDN آروان‌کلاد نشان می‌دهد که هم‌زمان با جمعه سیاه (Black Friday) ترافیک فروشگاه‌های اینترنتی افزایش ۴.۶۳ برابری نسبت به هفته قبل (جمعه ۳۰ آبان) را تجربه کرده‌اند.

title: دیدار قریب‌الوقوع حزب الله با نماینده پاپ در لبنان
summary: عضو فراکسیون وفا به مقاومت لبنان از برگزاری یک نشست میان نمایندگان حزب الله و نماینده پاپ در این کشور خبر داد.

title: مظفری: شهدا با الهام از مکتب کربلا حقانیت جمهوری اسلامی را تثبیت کردند
summary: زنجان- معاون قضایی قوه قضاییه گفت: شهدا با پیروی از امام حسین‌(ع) و مکتب کربلا، حقیقت و حقانیت جمهوری اسلامی را استوار کردند.
